oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bank note in the amount of 75 cents
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate bank note in the amount of 75 cents, drawn on Bank of the Empire State, in Rome, Georgia. In the antebellum and Civil War era it was common for local banks to issue their own currency to overcome the dearth of hard specie and national bank notes. This practice continued after the creation of the Confederate States of American in 1861.
